about.appDescription: Tsuuchinoko is a specialized task management application designed to enhance productivity for Kintone users. It bridges the gap between Kintone notifications and actionable tasks, allowing users to efficiently manage their workflow across devices.
about.problemDescription: In Kintone, notifications often represent actionable items that require follow-up: checking documents, inputting data, or reviewing information. However, there's no built-in way to track these items as tasks.
about.solutionDescription: Tsuuchinoko combines a Chrome extension for converting notifications into tasks with a cross-platform desktop application for managing those tasks. This creates a seamless workflow for tracking and completing action items.
about.technicalDescription: Tsuuchinoko uses OAuth authentication with Kintone. Tokens are hashed and stored locally on this machine. Tasks and notification content is not stored on the machine, only in Kintone.
about.securityDescription: While the application employs secure storage practices, environments with highly sensitive information should be aware that determined attackers could potentially decrypt OAuth tokens if they gain physical access to your device.
about.betaVersion: This is currently a beta version for testing. Future plans for v1.0 include:
about.futurePlan1: Task assignment to other Tsuuchinoko users
about.extensionDescription: Install the companion Chrome extension to convert Kintone notifications into tasks.

dataStorage.title: Where is this data stored?
dataStorage.content1: For authentication with Kintone, the OAuth Client ID, Client Secret, subdomain, domain, Tsuuchinoko Space ID, user's username, and the resulting OAuth Access Tokens are hashed and stored locally on this machine.
dataStorage.content2: Task data is not stored on the machine, only in Kintone.

dataUsage.title: Where is this data used?
dataUsage.content1: The OAuth tokens are used when fetching and updating tasks. The OAuth Client ID and Client Secret are used when renewing the OAuth Tokens.
dataUsage.content2: Communication only happens between the registered Kintone domain and Tsuuchinoko, and is not sent to 3rd parties in any way.

apiUsage.title: How much is the Kintone API used?
apiUsage.content1: Task syncing defaults to once every 15 minutes, but can be adjusted from every 1 minute to once every 60 minutes. The task sync button can also be pressed at any time.
apiUsage.content2: When tasks are synced, overdue tasks are detected and updated. Additionally, tasks can be completed or deleted by users manually.
apiUsage.content3: The number of automatic API calls can be expressed as:
apiUsage.formula: API calls per hour = (Users × Manual operations) + (Users × 60 ÷ Sync interval in minutes)
apiUsage.example: Example: 50 users with a sync time of 15 minutes completing 2 tasks per hour would total 300 API requests per hour on average.

dataRemoval.title: Can all data be removed?
dataRemoval.content1: All data can be erased from the Account page after logging in. The Tsuuchinoko App can also delete its own user's repository app. The Tsuuchinoko space must be deleted manually.
dataRemoval.locationsTitle: All stored data is saved in the following locations, and can be deleted manually:
dataRemoval.android: Android: Settings > Apps > Tsuuchinoko > Storage & cache > Clear Storage / Clear Cache
dataRemoval.ios: iOS: Settings > Tsuuchinoko > Clear App Data (or reinstall the app)
